Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white lines; below, tongue pattern in white outlines and alternate tongues red; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion seated to right (torso and hindquarters remaining; red patches on rump and body); below, band of black dots between lines.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 297, no. 984, pl. 137)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1978) (phase 2)
